sub_title: Architect, Innovation and Architecture group at Nationale-Nederlanden
summary:
Sukumar Daniel, an innovative architect and strategist, has long dedicated himself to the pursuit of knowledge and the propagation of groundbreaking ideas in technology based service delivery in enterprises.

Unrestricted by convention, he is a driving force for innovation, embracing emergent systems and championing for a data-centric world.

Known for his advocacy for Emergent Operating Models (EOMs), Sukumar's vision is for businesses to transition from static structures to more dynamic, flexible ones. Drawing parallels from nature, particularly a butterfly's metamorphosis, he navigates companies through the intricate process of evolution in the face of constant change.

As a prominent voice for data centricity, Sukumar propounds a radical shift from application-focused methods to prioritizing the preservation of Event data in imutable streams. He views data as the enduring essence of business, transcending the temporary lifespan of applications, to drive long-term growth, real-time decision-making, and taking innovative leaps in technology.

Sukumar has articulated these thoughts and strategies through numerous LinkedIn articles, inviting and facilitating thoughtful discussions on these subjects. His work emphasizes the value of data streams, the significance of breaking free from application constraints, and the transformative journey of Emergent Operating Models.

In the next chapter of his career, Sukumar sees himself continuing in the roles of coach and evangelist, promoting continuous evolution and embracing the data-centric paradigm. His passion is to inspire the young and experienced alike, fostering an environment that encourages mutual growth and the exchange of ideas. 

Sukumar invites everyone to join him in shaping the future of business in the digital era.

profile_positions.title: IT Management Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Action Research Foundation, is a Boutique ITSM Enterprise Architecture Design Studio, founded in the year 2006 and is a recognised thought leader in the IT Operating Model transformation space.
The practice included mentoring 'Organisational Transformation' of IT Departments to systematically build capabilities and adopt a Service Oriented, IT Operating Model for multi-sourced service delivery.
 
The FlexMode™ paradigm shift framework, the cornerstone of ARF methodology, has evolved over multiple intervention engagements and today is one of the few tested and proven methodologies to bring together a multidisciplinary approach managing Strategic Transformations.
 
FlexMode™ uses innovative techniques to rapidly establish staged capability growth paths; collaborating with staff to transform legacy mechanic shop Technology Silo IT Operating Models, into a customisation studio Service-Oriented IT Operating Model, achieving  Business-IT convergence in a multi-sourced; multi-paced; next generation; IT Operating Model where the CIO is the broker.

ARF methodology, ‘capability building not project implementation’, produced verifiable value outcomes for, ING Vysa Bank; Tata Motors; Tesco PLC; Jaguar Land Rover; NTT Data; Rakuten, Global IT Service Provider; and Brandix.

An active member of the Architecture and IT4IT Open Group forums we are amongst the first enterprise architects, to co-work with customers in realising values from using the IT4IT™ reference architecture and one of the first 11 organisations to achieve accreditation for providing certified IT4IT Foundation for Practitioners training.

ARF has demonstrated the capability to work with senior executives, understand strategic imperatives, assess baseline architectures, develop visionary, future connected transformation strategy roadmaps architect solutions and deliver services along with a planned capability increment roadmap resulting in measurable change and improved value outcomes for stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Principal Architect & Action Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Strategic Objective:
Remove barriers and enable reaching audacious business goals by transforming the Operating Model, into one more suitable, for a primary manufacturing role in evolving, Agile Supply Chains, in the Global Fashion Industry.

Tactical Objectives:
The legacy IT systems are facing the end of life, giving an opportunity to embed agility sought by customers, using the next generation of investment in technology; use this to create a sense of urgency required to drive the initiative.

Innovate a new Value Chain for an Apparel Manufacturing Enterprise, seeking to maintain and grow a primary role in Agile Supply Chains, in the Global Fashion Industry and use it for designing the next generation operating model.

Achievements:
Used Action Research, Kotter’s Change Model, TOGAF, IT4IT and Archimate along with Evolving Agile Supply Chains practices, in the Global Fashion Industry; to drive the Enterprise Architecture driven business transformation initiative with following outcomes

Established a change in the Silo Culture and overcame resistance to establish a common Value Chain Based Operating models which provides the flexibility required to meet value needs of different apparel categories, while providing a common Foundation Data Structure, that allows for transparency of value generation and delivery from conceiving the garment to delivering to the end user.

Created a Conceptual Service model of the requirements for Information technology suitable for business collaboration with the customers, raw material suppliers, production process partners, and other stakeholders in the Global Apparel Industry agile supply chains.

Created a Strategic Capability Transformation Roadmap for achieving the next generation Operating Model, enabling Internal IT to become a strategic partner to the business.

Voice of the Customer:
You have given us a Bible for the future, now we will go and live it.
profile_positions.title: Consulting Archiect

company.name: A Large Global Service Provider Organisation

profile_positions.company: A Large Global Service Provider Organisation
profile_positions.description:
Strategic Objective:
Create a Paradigm Shift in ways of working to meet evolving customer requirements, while meeting business objectives and achieving people happiness.

Achievements:
Stop being an IT Repair Shop; become an IT Customisation Studio, a Strategic Partner delivering and supporting Business Processes automation; flexible meeting of strategic needs.

Establish Architecture Capability; use it to instantiate an Organisational Change intervention and;
Create an innovation eco-system (customisation mindset); improve alignment between Organisational Demands and People Needs.

Architect Next Generation IT Operating Model and Technical Function Capability Architecture; for aligning ITSM activities with a ‘Structured Capability Growth Ladder’; improving people happiness through ‘Self Awareness’ of where they stand, what next and how to get there.

Architect and deliver Function Capability Management and People Career Management services; staged by a Capability Increment Road Map, reap Low Hanging fruit.

Use TOGAF ADM; IT4IT RA; SFIA; and FlexMode; iteratively, develop and deliver Conceptual, Logical, Physical Service Model; provide requirements and mentor building of application platform, release for use.

Establish ITSM COE, a new business function, to own Architecture Capability; service’s support and governance. Provide stability and continuity of purpose; publish achievements; anchor the change in culture.

Mentor practitioners in prototyping, incubating and scaling out to organisation.  Create syllabi, content,  deliver train the trainer L&D programs to transfer learning to doing; for Mangers  and Members.

Voice of the Customer:
You have provided thought leadership and delivered an ‘Elegant and Innovative’ architecture; providing us with means to transform from a Vanilla Service Offering to offer Chocolate Sundae; a state of the Art Service Owner Services.
profile_positions.title: Consulting Architect and Co-Owner of Change Management Initiative

profile_positions.description:
Establishing a sustainable and scalable, custom built SOA framework, for the next generation Rakuten IT Service Management System (R – ITSMS)

Strategic Objective: 
Partner the Business to win in the Global market place by becoming one of the Finest IT organisations in any Enterprise.

Tactical Objectives: 
Establish a foundation for the next generation Rakuten – IT Service Management System (R – ITSM) by applying the FlexMode Paradigm Shift Framework to; 

Create a Service Oriented Architecture ITSM Framework common Policies, Process and Tools; used by all IT departments to standardise management of Service Request, Incident and Service Level processes in the first phase.

Deploy the architecture and embedding processes in a common service management tool for use by all teams, across departments, to ensure collaboration and Standardisation.

Establish metrics to track Quality of Service and Performance and analytics to help in the identification of Improvement opportunities, implementing and verifying effectiveness of continual improvement projects.
profile_positions.title: Consulting Architect

profile_positions.description:
Establishing an IT SM COE and implementing a Service Oriented Architecture Roadmap for the NTT DATA, Corporate IT Service Management System.

Applying FlexMode IP Service Oriented Architecture IT Service Management Transformation Framework to; 

•	Establish a COE for IT Service Management which will oversee the establishment of an IT Service Management System required for transforming current Corporate Internal IT services organisation into a Shared Services Configuration compliant to the requirement of ISO 20000 International Standard for Service Management.

•	Establishing a Governance Structure for the effective implementation of an efficient and effective IT Service Management System to meet strategic objectives of Corporate IT

•	Ensuring that process Automation layer, using the BMC Remedy Suite of Applications, effectively embeds processes and provides Management Information required for establishing management control and continually improving customer outcomes

•	Ensure that Architectural Principles are Identified and deployed to put in place a Service Oriented Architecture Framework for the ITSM to transform from Technology Focus to a Service Oriented Focus.

•	Creating policies to meet strategic needs when the ITSMS is scaled up to cover multiple locations across the globe especially in the areas of Service Level Management, Prioritisation, Tracking across Geographically and technically diverse support groups and organisation.

•	Creating policies to meet strategic needs when the ITSMS is scaled up to cover multiple locations across the globe especially in the areas of Service Level Management, Prioritisation, Tracking across Geographically and technically diverse support groups and organisation.

•	Ensure that the PDCA Continual improvement cycle is embedded in the DNA of the SMS

•	To do the above using the principles and methodology outlined in the FlexMode IP paradigm shift framework for IT Service Management Systems
profile_positions.title: Consulting Architect, Corp IT Group

profile_positions.description:
This Assignment won the 2011 Enterprise and IT Architecture Excellence Award for ITSM

Use the Zachman's EA Framework to create a Tesco Specific Enterprise IT architectural framework, including Classification of Incidents and Categorization of Closing Codes to establish a common service definition across 15 countries, which will aid the convergence process and be suitable for use during the transition to the to be phase

Use the Kotter's Organisational Change and Development Framework to devise a strategy to engage all Service Delivery Units and create a 100-day plan for deployment. Market the plan to the IT Service Director for acquiring required executive sponsorship and commitment

Establish Project Governance as per the principles outlined in PRINCE 2, including an HPD (Head Program Delivery) Steering Committee Chaired by the IT Director, SPOC for each HPD Area, Project Tracking Team and Training Programs and Launch the project.

Embed Continual Improvement in the DNA of IT Services provided by Tesco HSC using an Enterprise Architecture Driven Approach for ITSM Transformation by devising and managing the Transformation program

Teach Operational staff, the mindset difference between collaborating in delivering a Business Service Enabler as opposed to merely delivering a technology from inside a Silo. 

Embedding Continual Improvement in the DNA of Tesco ITSM
Create a program for establishing Systematic Service Improvement in all the HPD areas and establish periodic governance reporting

Prepare Training Material and train the trainers and establish an ITSM Practioner and Expert Certification mechanisms.
profile_positions.title: Consultant ITSM Transformation Initiative

profile_positions.description:
Designing an organisation structure (support model L1/2/3 + Change + Problem) to best meet the requirements of the project
• Defining and aligning KPIs for all parts of the support model
• Defining and aligning objectives for all roles within the support model
• Establishing a transformation programme to deliver the 3 objectives above (inc leadership training for support leads)
• Identifying core training needs to deliver the objectives and deliver a plan to address
• Lead newsletters / employee communication/ training for the programme
• Delivering a training programme and user guides to ensure sucessful take-up of new tool
profile_positions.title: Head - People Stream of the IT Transformation Project at Tesco

profile_positions.description:
Support the IT Service Management Improvement and Consolidation Strategy by participating in the TML CIO's initiative to recast the CIO organisation Structure to establish an effective Internal IT Service Management System.

Build on the foundations laid and improvements made since 2008 and build competencies in the CIO Organisation Executive and operational management to take up Service Management Roles and relationship management with the Business and Service Providing Community.

Increase awareness levels on using Enterprise Architecture Techniques to create a Service Oriented Architecture which uses common sense to create a TML specific Service Management System based on the FlexMode SOA Transformation Framework

To create awareness of the knowledge available in repositories such as ITIL and CobiT and understand the Intent of the requirements of International Standards such as ISO 9000, ISO 20000, ISO 27000, ISO 38500 and other applicable Technical Reports released by the ISO.

To create the framework for defining the Remedy Foundation Data by applying lessons learnt over the last three years.

Build Competencies required to Design and implement Systems for adoption across all service providers working through state of the art Contact Centers for supporting customers.

To create capabilities to visualise, design and implement End to End monitoring and tracking of all Service Component assets including infrastructure, software and Support costs.
profile_positions.title: Trusted People Development Partner

profile_positions.description: Develop Strategy for ITSM Transition and Transformation, Establish Road Map for Tool Deployment, Define a service oriented architecture for deployment in Remedy, establish policies for Incident, Change and Problem Management, provide Remedy Configuration Road Map and Data Collection Templates, Review and establish process flows.
